question: Let us consider  the subalgorithm what(n) , where n is a natural number (1 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 10000). Subalgorithm what(n): nr ‚Üê 0 For d ‚Üê 1, n execute If n MOD d = 0 then nr ‚Üê nr + 1 EndIf EndFor If nr = 2 then return true else return false EndIf EndSubalgorithm Which of the following statements are true ?

answers.A: The subalgorithm  returns true if n is odd.

answers.B: The subalgorithm  returns true if n is even.

answers.C: The subalgorithm returns  true if n is prime.

answers.D: The subalgorithm returns  true if n is a perfect square.

question: Given that x < y (x and y are real numbers), which of the following expressions have the value true if and only if the value of t (t is a real number) DOES NOT belong to the interval (x, y)?

answers.A: (t > x) OR (t < y)

answers.B: (t ‚â§ x) OR (t ‚â• y)

answers.C: (t ‚â§ x) AND (t ‚â• y)

answers.D: (t > x) AND (t < y)

question: Let us consider the subalgorithm  f(n),  where n is a natural number (1 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 10000): Subalgorithm f(n): r ‚Üê 0 While n > 0 execute r ‚Üê r + (n MOD 10) * (n MOD 2) n ‚Üê n DIV 10 EndWhile return r EndSubalgorithm Select the choices that correctly fill in the underlined section from the subalgorithm  below such that both subalgorithms will always return the same value. Subalgorithm fr(n): If n > 0 then return _________________ EndIf return 0 EndSubalgorithm

answers.A: (n MOD 2) * (n MOD 10) + fr(n DIV 10)

answers.B: (n MOD 2) * (n MOD 10) * fr(n DIV 10)

answers.C: (n MOD 10) + fr(n DIV 10)

answers.D: (n MOD 2) * (n MOD 10) + fr(n MOD 10) 2

question: Let us consider the subalgorithm  f(n)  where n is a natural number (1 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 10000). Subalgorithm f(n): For i ‚Üê 1, n execute For j ‚Üê 1, 2 * i - 1 execute write '*' EndFor EndFor EndSubalgorithm Which of the following statements are true?

answers.A: For n = 3 the subalgorithm prints  3 stars

answers.B: For n = 3 the subalgorithm prints 9 stars

answers.C: In order for the subalgorithm  to print  1154 stars, the value of  n must  be 34

answers.D: In order for the subalgorithm to print 289 stars,  the value of  n must  be 17

question: The subalgorithm below has as input parameters an array v of n natural numbers (v[1], v[2], ‚Ä¶, v[n]) and the whole number n (2 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 10000). The / operator denotes real division (e.g. 3/2=1.5). Array v contains at least one even number and at least one odd number. Subalgorithm  fn(v, n): a ‚Üê 0 b ‚Üê 0 For i ‚Üê 1, n execute If v[i] MOD 2 = 0 then a ‚Üê a + v[i] b ‚Üê b + 1 EndIf EndFor return a / b EndSubalgorithm Which of the following statements are true ?

answers.A: The subalgorithm returns the number of even elements from the array v

answers.B: The subalgorithm returns the average of the even elements from the array v

answers.C: The subalgorithm returns the sum of the even elements from the array v

answers.D: The subalgorithm returns the average of the odd elements from the array v

question: The subalgorithm below has as input parameters an array v of n natural numbers  (v[1], v[2], ‚Ä¶, v[n]) and the whole number n (1 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 10000). Subalgorithm fn(v, n): a ‚Üê 0 For i ‚Üê 1, n execute ok ‚Üê 1 b ‚Üê v[i] While (b ‚â† 0) AND (ok = 1) execute If b MOD 2 = 0 then ok ‚Üê 0 EndIf b ‚Üê b DIV 10 EndWhile If ok = 1 then a ‚Üê a + v[i] EndIf EndFor return a EndSubalgorithm  3 Which of the following statements are true ?

answers.A: The subalgorithm returns the sum of the odd elements from the array  v

answers.B: The subalgorithm returns the sum of the elements from the array  v that are powers of 2

answers.C:
The subalgorithm returns the sum of the elements from the array  v that are composed of only
even digits

answers.D:
The subalgorithm returns the sum of the elements from the array  v that are composed of only
odd digits

question: Which of the following subalgorithms  compute the absolute value of an integer ? We will assume that a logical expression has the value 1 if it is true and 0 if it is false.

answers.B:
Subalgorithm  modul(n):
If n < 0 then
return n * (-1)
EndIf
return n
EndSubalgorithm

answers.C:
Subalgorithm modul(n):
If n < 0 then
return n * (-1)
else
return n
EndIf
EndSubalgorithm

answers.D:
Subalgorithm  modul(n):
If n > 0 then
return n * (-1)
else
return n
EndIf
EndSubalgorithm

question: What is the value of the expression below, if x = 15 and y = 17? (NOT (x MOD 10 = 0)) AND (y MOD 2 = 0) AND (x < y)

answers.A: true

answers.B: false

answers.C: Err or

answers.D: The expression cannot be evaluated

question: Let us consider the recursive subalgorithm what(n, i) , where n is a natural number (2 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 1000). Subalgorithm what(n, i): If i = 1 then return i else If n MOD i = 0 then return i + what(n, i - 1) else return what(n, i - 1) EndIf EndIf EndSubalgorithm Which of the following statements are true when  calling  what(n, n )?

answers.A: The subalgorithm returns the successor of the greatest divisor of n

answers.B: The subalgorithm returns the sum of the non-prime  natural numbers up to and including n

answers.C: The subalgorithm returns the sum of the proper divisors of n

answers.D: The subalgorithm returns the sum of the  proper and improper divisors of n

question: The s ubalgorithm  magic(s, n)  has as input parameters an array s of n characters  (s[1], s[2], ‚Ä¶, s[n]) and the whole number n (1 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 10000). 4 Subalgorithm magic(s, n) : i ‚Üê 1 f ‚Üê 1 While i ‚â§ n DIV 2 execute If s[i] ‚â† s[n - i + 1] then f ‚Üê 0 EndIf i ‚Üê i + 1 EndWhile return f EndSubalgorithm Which of the following statements are true ?

answers.A: The subalgorithm returns 1 if s has an even number of char acters .

answers.B: The subalgorithm returns 1 if s has an odd number of characters .

answers.C: The subalgorithm returns 1 if s is a palindrome.

answers.D: The subalgorithm returns 1 if s contains only distinct characters .

question: Which of the following expression s have the value true if and only if x is an odd and negative number? We denote with | x| the absolute value of x.

answers.A: (|x| MOD 2 = 1) AND (x < 0)

answers.B: NOT ((|x| MOD 2 = 0) AND (x ‚â• 0))

answers.C: NOT ((|x| MOD 2 = 0) OR (x ‚â• 0))

answers.D: (|x| MOD 2 ‚â† 0) OR (x < 0)

question: The s ubalgorithm what(n)  has as input parameter the natural number n (0 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 10000). Subalgorithm what(n): s ‚Üê 0 While n > 0 execute c ‚Üê n MOD 10 If c MOD 2 ‚â† 0 then s ‚Üê s + c EndIf n ‚Üê n DIV 10 EndWhile return s EndSubalgorithm What will the call  what(1234) return ?

Let us consider an array of char acters  and a function f which receives a char acter  parameter and returns 1 if it is a digit and 0 otherwise. Which of the following approaches determines if the array of character s is composed only of digits?

answers.A: Check if the function f, applied on each char acter  of the array  of ch aracters always returns 1.

answers.B:
Check if the sum of the values returned by f, applied on each char acter  of the array of char acter s,
is equal to the length of the array of char acter s.

answers.C:
Check if the function f, applied on each char acter  of the array of char acter s, returns 1 at least
once.

answers.D:
Apply the function f on randomly chosen char acter s from the array of characters until the
number of returned values equal to 1 is equal to the length of the array.

5

question: Which of the following algorit hms can be implemented such that they have a linear time complexity (O(n))?

answers.A: The sequential search of an element in an array of n numbers .

answers.B: The insertion sort algorithm applied on a one-dimensional array of n numbers.

answers.C: The algorithm that search es for the maximum number in an unsorted array of n numbers.

answers.D:
The algorithm that computes the sum of the elements from the main diagonal of a square matrix
with n rows and n columns.

question: Let us consider the subalgorithm f(a, b) , where a and b are natural numbers (1 ‚â§ a, b ‚â§ 10000). Subalgorithm f(a, b): m ‚Üê a While b MOD m > 0 execute m ‚Üê m + 1 EndWhile return m EndSubalgorithm For which of the following calls will the body of the While  loop be executed at most once?

Let us consider the subalgorithm  f(a, b) , where a and b are natural numbers (1 ‚â§ a, b ‚â§ 10000). Subalgorithm f(a, b): c ‚Üê 0 d ‚Üê 0 p ‚Üê 1 While a + b + c > 0 execute c ‚Üê a MOD 10 + b MOD 10 + c d ‚Üê d + (c MOD 10) * p p ‚Üê p * 10 a ‚Üê a DIV 10 b ‚Üê b DIV 10 c ‚Üê c DIV 10 EndWhile return d EndSubalgorithm What will the f(493, 1836)  call return?

Let us consider  the subalgorithm print(M, n) which receives as parameter an array M of n (n ‚â§ 10) whole numbers  (M[1], M[2], ‚Ä¶, M[n]) representing a set. Subalgorithm  print(M, n): nr ‚Üê 2n k ‚Üê 0 While k < nr execute curent ‚Üê k write '{' For j = 1, n execute r ‚Üê curent MOD 2 curent ‚Üê curent DIV 2 If r = 1 then write M[j] EndIf EndFor write '}' write new line k ‚Üê k + 1 EndWhile EndSubalgorithm  6 Which of the following statements are true ?

answers.A: The subalgorithm prints all the permutations of the set M.

answers.B:
The subalgorithm prints all the combinations of the elements of the set M taken i at a time,
where  i = 0, 1, ..., n (not necessarily in this order).

answers.C:
The subalgorithm prints all the permutations of the elements of the set  M taken i at a time ,
where  i = 0, 1, ..., n (not necessarily in this order).

answers.D: The subalgorithm prints all the subsets of the set M.

question: Let us consider  subalgorithm s(a, b, c), where a, b, c are positive natural numbers (1 ‚â§ a, b, c ‚â§ 10000). Subalgorithm s(a, b, c): If (a = 1) OR (b = 1) OR (c = 1) then return 1 else If a > b then return a * s(a - 1, b, c) else If a < b then return b * s(a, b - 1, c) else return c * s(a - 1, b - 1, c - 1) EndIf EndIf EndIf EndSubalgorithm Which of the following statements are true if  a = b and a < c:

answers.A: The subalgorithm computes and returns c!

answers.B: The subalgorithm computes and returns c! / (c ‚Äì a + 1)!

answers.C: The subalgorithm computes and returns c! / (c ‚Äì a ‚Äì 1)!

answers.D: The subalgorithm computes and returns  the number of permutations of c taken (a - 1) at a time

question: The following subalgorithm has as input parameters the array A of n natural numbers ( A[1], A[2], ‚Ä¶, A[n]) and the natural number n (1 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 10000). For the natural numbers x and y, x^y has the meaning x raised to the power of y (xy). Subalgorithm  h(A, n): If n = 0 then return 0 else return A[n] * ( -1)^(1 - A[n] MOD 2) + h(A, n - 1) EndIf EndSubalgorithm Which of the following statements are true?

answers.A:
The subalgorithm returns the difference between the sum of the elements on even positions
and the sum of the elements on odd positions in array

answers.B:
The subalgorithm returns the difference between the sum of the even elements and the sum of
the odd elements of array

answers.C:
The subalgorithm returns the difference between the sum of the odd elements and the sum of
the even elements of array

answers.D:
None of the ot her answer s are correct.

7

question: An Excel file contains n records numbered from 1 to n. These records are copied into a Word file, where the records will be arranged in maximum r rows and exactly c columns on each page.  It is guaranteed that the value of n will always allow ar ranging the records  in exactly c columns. Let us denote by x1, ..., xc the number of records that are copied on each column for a specific page. The first page of the Word document  includes a header , so the number of rows is r1, r1 < r (the number of rows on the first page is smaller), namely xp = r1, ‚àÄ 1 ‚â§ p ‚â§ c. The records will be arranged in the Word file on each page starting from top to bottom on each column, the columns being filled in from the left hand side to the right hand side: if the first record on some page is numbered i, the record numbered as (i + 1) will be placed below it, while the record numbered as (i + x1) will be the first record on the second column of the same page, and so on. On the last page of the Word document,  it is required that the number of records is balanced across the columns, me aning that the difference between the number of records on any two columns is at most 1 (|xj - xk| ‚â§ 1, ‚àÄ 1 ‚â§ j, k ‚â§ c, j ‚â† k). For all other pages (except for the first and the last page) xp = r, ‚àÄ 1 ‚â§ p ‚â§ c. For n = 5883, r = 46, r1 = 12 and c = 2, on which row of the page will the last record of the document be placed (the record numbered with i = 5883 )?

Let us consider  the subalgorithm compute(a, b, c, d, e) , which receives as parameters  five whole numbers  a, b, c, d and e (1 ‚â§ a, b ‚â§ 10000, 2 ‚â§ c ‚â§ 16, 1 ‚â§ d < c). Subalgorithm  compute(a, b, c, d, e): If a = 0 AND b = 0 then If e = 0 then return 1 else return 0 EndIf EndIf If (a MOD c = d) AND (b MOD c = d) then return compute(a DIV c, b DIV c, c, d, e) EndIf If a MOD c = d then return compute(a DIV c, b DIV c, c, d, e + 1) EndIf If b MOD c = d then return compute(a DIV c, b DIV c, c, d, e - 1) else return compute(a DIV c, b DIV c, c, d, e) EndIf EndSubalgorithm Which of the following statements are true for the call  compute(a, b, c, d, 0) ?

answers.A:
Returns 1 if the base c representation s of the numbers a and b contain the digit d the same
number of times, 0 otherwise

answers.B:
Returns 1 if the digit d occurs in the base c representation of the number a and in the base c
representation of the number b, 0 otherwise

answers.C:
Returns 1 if the digit d occurs in the base c representation of the number a or in the base c
representation of the number  b, 0 otherwise

answers.D: Returns 1 if the digit d does not occur in the base c representation s of a and b, 0 otherwise  8

question: Let us consider the subalgorithms  val(p, s, i, n, x)  and val_exp(p, n, x) with the following parameter specification: an array p of n whole numbers  (p[1], p[2], ‚Ä¶, p[n]), the natural numbers s, i and n (n ‚â§ 1000, n = 2k, k < 10), and the real number x. The values of the array p represent the coefficients of the expression in increasing order of the exponents, the maximum exponent being equal to n - 1, for an expression of the form p[1] + p[2] ¬∑ x + p[3] ¬∑ x2 +...+ p[n] ¬∑ xn-1 E.g: p = [1, 2, 3, 4] corresponds to the expression E(x)=1 + 2x + 3x2 + 4x3. Subalgorithm  val(p, s, i, n, x): If s + i ‚â§ n then ________________________ else return p[s] EndIf EndSubalgorithm Subalgorithm  val_exp (p, n, x): return val(p, 1, 1, n, x) EndSubalgorithm Which of the following choices correctly fill in the underlined section such that the subalgorithm val_exp(p, n, x)  returns the value of the expression E(x)?

answers.A: return p[s] + x * val(p, s + i, i  * 2, n , x * x)

answers.B: return val(p, s, i * 2, n - i, x * x) + x * val(p, s + i, i * 2, n, x * x)

answers.C: return val(p, s + i, i * 2, n, x * x) + x * val(p, s, i * 2, n - i, x * x)

answers.D: return p[s] + x * val(p, s + i, i, n, x)

question: Let us consider the subalgorithm f(a), which receives as parameter a natural number a (2 ‚â§ a < 1000000)  and returns true  if a natural number d, 1 < d < a exists such that d divides a, and false otherwise.  We use [ x] to represent the integer part of the number x. Which of the following versions of the subalgorithm  f(a) are correct?

answers.A:
Subalgorithm f(a):
If a = 2 then
return false
EndIf
If a MOD 2 = 0 then
return true
EndIf
For d ‚Üê 3, [ ‚àöùëé] - 1, 2 execute
If a MOD d = 0 then
return true
EndIf
EndFor
return false
EndSubalgorithm

answers.B:
Subalgorithm  f(a):
For d ‚Üê 2,[ ‚àöùëé] execute
If a MOD d = 0 then
return true
EndIf
EndFor
return false
EndSubalgorithm

answers.C:
Subalgorithm  f(a):
If a ‚â§ 2 then
return false
EndIf
If a MOD 2 = 0 then
return true
EndIf
For d ‚Üê 3, [ ‚àöùëé], 2 execute
If a MOD d = 0 then
return true
EndIf
EndFor
return false
EndSubalgorithm

answers.D:
Subalgorithm f(a):
d ‚Üê a - 1
While true  execute
If a MOD d = 0 then
return true
EndIf
d ‚Üê d - 1
EndWhile
return false
EndSubalgorithm   9

question: Consider the expression below, where 1 < A < 2021 and 1 < n < 10202110. E(A, n) = (A + A2 + A3 + ... + An) MOD  2021 Which of the following subalgorithms correctly compute the value of  E(A, n) and have  the specified time complexity? All computations are carried out on 32 bit data types. The computation of  xk is assumed to be done in O(log k).

answers.A:
Subalgorithm  E(A, n):
return (A * (An - 1) DIV (A - 1)) MOD 2021
EndSubalgorithm

Time complexity: O(log n)

answers.B:
Subalgorithm  E(A, n):
return ((A * (An - 1)) MOD 2021) DIV ((A - 1) MOD 2021)
EndSubalgorithm

Time complexity: O(log n)

answers.C:
Subalgorithm  E1(A, n):
If n = 1 then
return (A, A) //returns a pair of values
EndIf
If n MOD 2 = 1 then
(t1, t2) ‚Üê E1(A, n - 1)
p ‚Üê (t1 * A) MOD 2021
return (p, (p + t2) MOD 2021)
else
(t1, t2) ‚Üê E1(A, n DIV 2)
p ‚Üê (t1 * t1) MOD 2021
return (p, ((1 + t1) * t2) MOD 2021)
EndIf
EndSubalgorithm

Subalgorithm  E(A, n):
(aux1, aux2) ‚Üê E1(A, n)
return aux2
EndSubalgorithm

Time complexity: O(log n)

answers.D:
Subalgorithm E(A, n):
raspuns ‚Üê A
For i = 2, n execute
raspuns ‚Üê raspuns + Ai
EndFor

return raspuns MOD 2021
EndSubalgorithm

Time complexity: O( n ¬∑ log n) 10

question: All numbers from 1 to 1000 are written  on a circle  in ascending order , clockwise. Starting from 1 and moving in clockwise order , we color each  k-th number (1, k + 1, 2 ¬∑ k + 1, ...). The process continues until we reach an already colored number, at the end having x colored  numbers. Which of the following statements are true?

answers.A: if k = 15 then x = 300

answers.B: if k = 45 then x = 200

answers.C: if k = 25 then x = 40

answers.D: if k = 30 then x = 150

question: Consider  the subalgorithm  what(n, k) , where n and k are natural numbers (1 ‚â§ n, k ‚â§ 1000000). Subalgorithm  what(n, k): nr ‚Üê 0 p ‚Üê 1 While (n ‚â† 0) AND (k ‚â† 0) execute if n MOD 2 ‚â† 0 then nr ‚Üê  nr + ((n DIV 10) MOD 10) * p p ‚Üê p * 10 else k ‚Üê k - 1 EndIf n ‚Üê n DIV 10 EndWhile return nr EndSubalgorithm Which of the following pairs of calls return identical values?

Consider the subalgorithms : ‚Ä¢ putere(b, p)  ‚Äì computes bp (b to the power p), b, p ‚Äì natural numbers  (1 ‚â§ b ‚â§ 20, 1 ‚â§ p ‚â§ 20); ‚Ä¢ nrCifre(nr)  ‚Äì returns the number of digits of the non -zero natural number nr (0 < nr ‚â§ 1000000), or the value 0 when nr = 0; ‚Ä¢ produs(st, dr ) ‚Äì the subalgorithm from below, where st, dr ‚Äì natural numbers (100 < st < 1000000, 0 ‚â§ dr < 1000000, st ‚Äì a number which, in it s base 10 representation, has at least two digits different from 0). Subalgorithm produs(st, dr) : If st > 0 then drCrt ‚Üê _____________________________ stCrt ‚Üê st DIV 10 If st * dr < stCrt * drCrt then return produs(stCrt, drCrt) else return st * dr EndIf else return st * dr EndIf EndSubalgorithm Which of the following versions correctly fill in the underlined section such that the subalgorithm produs(st, dr),  by executing the following sequence of instructions write produs(1092, 0) write produs(75981, 0) prints 920 and 73575?  11

answers.A: (st MOD 10) * putere(10, nrCifre(dr)) + dr

answers.B: (st MOD 10) * putere(10, dr) + dr

answers.C: (st MOD 10) * putere(10, nrCifre(dr))

answers.D: (st MOD 10) * nrCifre(dr)

question: Let us consider the subalgorithm what(a, n, i, f ), which receives as parameters an array a of n whole numbers (a[1], a[2], ‚Ä¶, a[n]) and the whole numbers i, f and n (2 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 10000). Subalgorithm  what(a, n, i, f): If (i = n) AND (f = 2) then return true else If (i = n) then return false else If (f ‚â§ 1) AND (a[i] < a[i + 1])  then return what(a, n, i + 1, 1) EndIf If (1 ‚â§ f) AND (a[i] > a[i  + 1])   then return what(a, n, i + 1, 2) EndIf return false EndIf EndIf EndSubalgorithm Which of the following statements are true, given the initial call  what(a,n,1,0) ?

answers.A:
The subalgorithm returns true if and only if the maximum of array a is located on a position i,
1 < i < n.

answers.B:
The subalgorithm returns true if and only if ‚àÉ k , (1 < k < n), such that a[1] < a[2] < ‚Ä¶ < a[k]
> a[k + 1] > ‚Ä¶ > a[n].

answers.C: The subalgorithm returns  false  if a is strictly increasing.

answers.D:
The subalgorithm returns  true if and only if ‚àÉ k , (1 < k < n), such that a[k] > a[k + 1] > ‚Ä¶ >
a[n].

question: Let us consider the following subalgorithm , with the input parameter the non -zero natural number n and which returns a natural number. Subalgorithm f(n): j ‚Üê n While j > 1 do i ‚Üê 1 While i ‚â§ n4 do i ‚Üê 4 * i EndWhile j ‚Üê j DIV 2 EndWhile return j EndSubalgorithm To which of the following complexity classes does the time complexity of the subalgorithm belong ?

answers.A: O(log 2 ùíèùüê)

answers.B: O(log 22 ùíèùüê)

answers.C: O(log 42 ùíè)

answers.D:
O(log 2 log 4 n)
12

question: Consider an array s of n character s from the English alphabet, ( s[1], s[2], ‚Ä¶, s[n]). We would like to find its longest suffix that is a palindrome. A suffix of an array of char acter s is a subarray of the given array that contains the last char acter . For example, for the array abab , the longest palindrome su ffix is bab. We assume that we have the following subalgorithm: ‚Ä¢ ascii(c ) - returns the ASCII code  of char acter  c. We assume that the arithmetic operations on integers do not overflow. Which of the following implementations return the length of this suffix when calling sufix(s, n) ?

answers.A:
Subalgorithm  sufix(s, n):
hf ‚Üê 0
hb ‚Üê 0
raspuns ‚Üê 1
For i ‚Üê n, 1, -1 execute
hf ‚Üê ascii(s[i]) + 2021 * hf
hb ‚Üê hb + ascii(s[i]) * 2021n - i

If hf = hb then
raspuns ‚Üê n ‚Äì i + 1
EndIf
EndFor
return raspuns
EndSubalgorithm

answers.B:
Subalgorithm  sufix(s, n):
hf ‚Üê 0
hb ‚Üê 0
raspuns ‚Üê 1
For i ‚Üê n, 1, -1 execute
hf ‚Üê ascii(s[i]) + 3 * hf
hb ‚Üê hb + ascii(s[i]) * 3n - i

If hf = hb then
raspuns ‚Üê n ‚Äì i + 1
EndIf
EndFor
return raspuns
EndSubalgorithm

answers.C:
Subalgorithm  sufix(s, n):
hf ‚Üê 0
hb ‚Üê 0
raspuns ‚Üê 1
For i ‚Üê n, 1, -1 execute
hf ‚Üê ascii(s[i]) + 2021 * hb
hb ‚Üê hf + ascii(s[i]) * 2021n - i

If hf = hb then
raspuns ‚Üê n ‚Äì i + 1
EndIf
EndFor
return raspuns
EndSubalgorithm

answers.D: None of the other versions are correct.
